title: How to Do a Messy Bun (for Curly Hair)

steps.title: Start with dry hair, and have everything you need on hand.
steps.content: Start with dry hair, and have everything you need on hand. Once you start making your bun, it will be difficult to open boxes and drawers. Keep a bunch of bobby pins handy, and your hair tie around your wrist. Try to use a hair tie that matches your hair color. You can find them in black, dark brown, and light brown/beige. If you have red hair, use either a dark brown or purple hair tie, depending on how colored/dark your hair is.

steps.title: Flip your hair forward.
steps.content: Flip your hair forward. Lean forward, like you are about to pick something up off the floor, so that your hair hangs straight down. This will make grabbing your hair easier, and ensure that all of those curly locks lay smooth.

steps.title: Start gathering your hair as though you are going to make a ponytail.
steps.content: Start gathering your hair as though you are going to make a ponytail. The hand that has the hair tie around it should by holding the hair; your other hand should be free.

steps.title: Slide the hair tie onto your hair.
steps.content: Slide the hair tie onto your hair. Grip the hair tie with your free hand, slide it over your wrist, and onto your hair.

steps.title: Pull your hair half-way through the hair tie.
steps.content: Pull your hair half-way through the hair tie. The ends should still caught under the hair tie, and the rest of your hair should be sticking out of it in a loop.

steps.title: Wrap the hair tie around your hair one or two more times.
steps.content: Wrap the hair tie around your hair one or two more times. Keep wrapping it until it is snug around your hair, and holding it securely. You'll end up with a fluffy fan on top of your head, and a bunch of loose ends sticking out from under the hair tie. If you find that your hair is getting snagged, pull your hair all the way through the hair tie, and wrap the hair tie around it once (like making a pony tail). Then, pull your hair half-way through the hair tie, and let go.

steps.title: Touch the bun up, if necessary.
steps.content: Touch the bun up, if necessary. You can leave your bun as is, or you make it messier. To do this, gently pull on each side of the bun until you get the fluffiness you want. You can also move the loose ends around so that they face different directions.

steps.title: Tuck any loose ends in, and pin them in place.
steps.content: Tuck any loose ends in, and pin them in place. You can even leave a few sticking out for a messier look.

steps.title: Consider using the loose ends to hide the hair tie.
steps.content: Consider using the loose ends to hide the hair tie. Take a loose strand, and wrap it around the base of your bun a few times, then pin it in place with a bobby pin. If you can still see the hair tie, repeat this step with another loose strand.

steps.title: Start with dry hair.
steps.content: Start with dry hair. Don't brush your curls because that will create frizz. If your hair is tangled, you can go through it gently with a wide toothed comb. It might also be a good idea to have both of your hair ties on your wrist, ready to go.

steps.title: Gather your hair up into a high ponytail.
steps.content: Gather your hair up into a high ponytail. If you want a smoother look, lean forward first, so that your hair hangs straight down, then gather it into the ponytail. This will ensure that your curly locks lay smooth.

steps.title: Wrap the hair tie around the base of the ponytail.
steps.content: Wrap the hair tie around the base of the ponytail. The easiest way to do is this to grab your hair with the hand that has the hair ties around it, then use your free hand to slide the ties off your wrist and onto your hair. Wrap the hair tie enough times so that it holds your hair securely.

steps.title: Wrap your hair around the base of the ponytail.
steps.content: Wrap your hair around the base of the ponytail. If you have a lot of layers, you might want to twist your hair into a loose rope first. Your bun will still look messy, but it will be easier to work with.

steps.title: Wrap a hair tie around the base of your bun.
steps.content: Wrap a hair tie around the base of your bun. Start by sliding the hair tie onto your bun, then wrapping it enough times so that it fits snugly. Try to get all of the loose ends of your hair under the hair tie.

steps.title: Secure your bun, if necessary, with bobby pins.
steps.content: Secure your bun, if necessary, with bobby pins. Curly hair is great for creating the messy bun look, but it can get heavy. After a while, it will work with gravy and begin to sag. To keep this from happening, use bobby pins to clip the top, bottom, and sides of your bun to your head.

steps.title: Touch your bun up, if needed.
steps.content: Touch your bun up, if needed. With a wide tooth comb pull little strands of hair out of the bun. You can also just play with it until some hair falls out.

steps.title: Grab your hairspray and spray a generous amount of hairspray into your hair.
steps.content: Grab your hairspray and spray a generous amount of hairspray into your hair. This will keep it together for the day.
